body: Quick thing I just checked: current jruby 9000 build "passes" on Travis but actually it's not running the specs: https://travis-ci.org/rspec/rspec-core/jobs/192034497

> Quick thing I just checked: current jruby 9000 build "passes" on Travis but actually it's not running the specs: https://travis-ci.org/rspec/rspec-core/jobs/192034497

Sure looks like it's running the specs to me.  Did you try expanding the collapsed output sections?  The one labeled "specs" (the command is `/home/travis/build/rspec/rspec-core/bin/rspec`) shows the RSpec output.

This is affecting me too.  I am getting this in my RSpec 3.5 output on JRuby 9.1.7.0 on Windows:

    Failure/Error: Unable to find matching line from backtrace

I traced through the RSpec code, going backwards in time from that error message and I determined that [line 267 of example.rb in rspec-core v3.5.4](https://github.com/rspec/rspec-core/blob/v3.5.4/lib/rspec/core/example.rb#L267). is rescuing an exception that has a nil backtrace for some reason.

issue.title: Exception backtrace is nil when it should be present

repository.name: jruby
repository.description: JRuby, an implementation of Ruby on the JVM

issue.body:
It looks like the [performance improvements mentioned on the JRuby blog](http://blog.jruby.org/2015/10/performance_improvements_in_jruby_9030/) probably broke exception backtrace generation in some cases.  This affected RSpec, causing the following bug: https://github.com/rspec/rspec-core/issues/2299.  I can reproduce the problem by running this very simple script in JRuby:

```ruby
begin
  raise
rescue ArgumentError
rescue StandardError => e
  if e.backtrace.nil?
    puts "Rescued an exception with no backtrace!"
  else
    puts "Looks good"
  end
end
```

Here is a shell session showing my environment and the output of that script:

```
$ jruby -v
jruby 9.1.7.0 (2.3.1) 2017-01-11 68056ae Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 25.121-b13 on 1.8.0_121-b13 +jit [mswin32-x86_64]
$ uname -a
MINGW64_NT-10.0 URANIUM 2.6.0(0.304/5/3) 2016-09-07 20:45 x86_64 Msys
$ jruby simple.rb
Rescued an exception with no backtrace!
```

MRI behaves as expected and prints "Looks good" when it runs that same script.

For anyone affected by this, a workaround is to add `=> _` to the first rescue statement.

issue.title: Fix exception backtraces on JRuby
issue.body: This pull request fixes #2299, which was caused by a JRuby bug: https://github.com/jruby/jruby/issues/4467.

body: After I reported the bug to the JRuby team, they [fixed it](https://github.com/jruby/jruby/commit/948554d431e1dbec832062d77fa4d1a1a06ab79a).  So the problem should be gone in JRuby 9.1.8.0 whenever it is released.
